sub_title: Value chain security Intern at Philip Morris International
summary: Content creator with an interest in trends and evocative communication, with editorial experience in Conde Nast Traveller and Architectural Digest Middle East.

school.name: American international school of Cape town

projects.title: Digital Magazine
projects.description:
Led a team through the creation of a digital magazine project in the midst of the pandemic; a digital magazine catering to 'future and prospective students, parents and guidance councillors' to promote the university as well as The Netherlands and answer to why an individual would want to study there. 
During this project we worked in teams of 5, I took the roles of a team leader,  co-content writer and co-art director; Which meant that I was responsible for assigning work to everyone in the team, and following up. I was also a co-content writer for the magazine and as well as managing the flow of designs and images through the magazine and making sure the theme is maintained. 
I worked heavily on the adobe Indesign, photoshop and illustrator software in order to complete the magazine and publish it.

contributors.headline: Value chain security Intern at Philip Morris International

projects.title: Model United Nations - India
projects.description:
Took part in the annual Model United Nations state conference, where I was delegated to be a political affairs journalist, working with a team of junior journalists and working along side photographers in the event, to bring visuals.
My job was the sit in several conferences that took part over the course of the three full days, record what was being discussed, transcribe them, analyse the information, and understand conclusions that were being drawn, i gathered along with reading what my junior journalists had gathered, and working with the internal communications department to publish them in forms of articles along with pictures from the photographers.

contributors.headline: Value chain security Intern at Philip Morris International

projects.title: Bilingual Music Album
projects.description: Aakanksha - #SaveOurSoul is a Girl Child's Voice, signifying hope on issues that cut across Religious, National and Ethnic Boundaries, A voice that highlights a decade long issue that has been going on behind closed doors, an issue rarely spoken about this album Celebrates Malala Yousafzai and hundreds alike, It  Denounces the acts committed against 'India's daughter' and Stands in Solidarity for the missing girls of Nigeria. It's a social problem turned voice.

contributors.headline: Value chain security Intern at Philip Morris International

projects.title: Model United Nations - Johannesburg
projects.description: Traveled to Johannesburg for a model united nations conference, and participated as the delegate of Tanzania and took part in a multitude of political affairs that were going on in the Sub-saharan region of Africa, whilst working alongside allies and working together to find plausible solutions.

contributors.headline: Value chain security Intern at Philip Morris International

profile_positions.description:
- Created the Value Chain Security Communications style guide 

- Led and managed the development of Value Chain Security Learning Journeys, providing employees with comprehensive and engaging training on security practices within the value chain.

- Ensured full compliance with PMI trademark guidelines for all Value Chain Security materials, safeguarding the company's branding integrity.

- Collaborated in the creation of 15+ training modules and presentations tailored for live trainings, workshops, and PMI-centric learning platforms, catering to diverse audience groups.

- Assisted in the reworking of supplier audits, contributing to the improvement of security standards within the supply chain.

- Published an article in the widely-read Security & Market Safety Newsletter, highlighting a security-specific milestone and promoting awareness across the organization.

- Standardized Value Chain Security PowerPoint templates and team backgrounds, maintaining a consistent and professional visual identity.

- Provided valuable insights and support in reviewing train transport standards as well as assessing its readability. 

- Developed internal communications strategies to ensure structural alignment and effective implementation of training initiatives.

- Participated in the development of training gamification, making learning interactive and enjoyable for employees through logo creation process, content and budget discussions. 

- Led a Canva training session for marketing and branding purposes, equipping team members with valuable graphic design skills and creative tools to elevate their deliverable
profile_positions.title: Value chain product security Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked as part of the editorial team of Condé Nast Traveller Middle East and contributed to Architectural Digest Middle East. 

Main responsibilities apart from the print magazine and administrative duties included: 

- Daily COVID-19 travel news updates 
- All of the festive roundups for 2021 (Christmas and NYE)
- Covering Doha hotspots (eateries)
- Covering the exclusive on “putting south India back on the culinary map” a CNT ME exclusive. 
- Top hotels round ups as well as up-and-coming round ups

And several culinary experiences as well as hospitality retreats.
profile_positions.title: Junior editorial assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
The sameness project is an organisation that created 'water for workers' An initiative to bring citizens of the city Dubai closer to those that work in the heat for hours on end. An initiative created to purchase and gather water bottles in bulk and distribute them amongst workers such as construction works. 
To encourage health, and erase the divisions of people in society, hence 'the sameness project'.
My role for the entire year that i volunteered with my class was keeping record of how many bottles were purchased and the contribution amongst individuals.

volunteer_experiences.role: teaching primary students and hosting an award ceremony
volunteer_experiences.description:
Spent a week teaching students at a village school different ways of drawing and painting using available equipment to teach them unique ways of interacting with art, Taught them to sing a few simple songs, and make acoustic music using their own body parts. 
At the end of the week, along with my family and extended family we put together a sports day where we played football, and rural games. At the end of the day we set up an award ceremony where every student received an award for their achievements during the sports day event, and any student left out was also given a goodie bag for being a team player. The teachers were given new school equipment to continue being able to provide and teach students to their best ability.
